title: Dictionary SMART for Health - Rangers
text:
Introduction
This is the Dictionary of SMART for Health - Rangers.
To view the definition of an Attribute or Option in particular, please select the appropriate language on left corner and then select the Category containing the Attribute(s) and the Option(s) to check from the menu below the list of versions in different languages.

title: Description du Site
text: AttributeTypeOptionDefinitionRésultatsMLISTAucun résultatSelect one or more items that are present at the Incident. If there are other relevant features at the Incident not provided in the options that could have disease or death implications, it is possible to select the option 'Other Findings' and a text box will pop-up to describe themZone inondéeOrduresBrûlureÉlimination des carcassesRejet des eaux uséesEngraisProduits chimiquesFumée ou smog (en vapeur)CoupeAutres résultatsAutres résultatsTEXTDescribe other relevant features at the Incident not provided in the                       'Findings' list that could have                           disease or death implications

title: Faune
text: AttributeTypeAttributeDefinitionOptionOptionDefinitionEspècesLISTThe wildlife species observed at the IncidentEspèces non répertoriéesSelect this option if the species at the Incident is not in the listFournir des espèces non répertoriéesTEXTA text field to provide the species observed at the Incident if it is not given in the 'Species' AttributeContexteMLISTThe context in which the animals of the corresponding species are found. Multiple options can be selectedTraqués et déplacésAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are observed in their habitat and not hunted, captured, captive, or restricted. These animals could be captured for health surveillance purposes and still be considered 'free-ranging'Chassé et non déplacéAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are hunted or captured at the time of the observation; however, they have been displaced from the original place of hunt or capture. For example, caged animals in posession of a walking hunter in a protected areaCentre de secours/réadaptationAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are hunted or captured at the time of the observation; however, they have not been displaced from the original place of hunt or capture. For example, animals observed in the trap set by a hunterEn libertéAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are kept in a rehabilitation/rescue centerFermeAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are kept in a farmMénageAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are kept in a householdRecherche ou capture pour conservationAnimals of the corresponding species are registered as part of a research or conservation capture not related with health surveillanceMarchéAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are kept in a marketPoste commercialAnimals of the corresponding species registered at the Incident are kept in a trade postNombre d'animaux en bonne santéNUMERICThe number of healthy animals of the corresponding species at the IncidentNombre d'animaux malades ou blessésThe number of sick or injured animals of the corresponding species at the IncidentAnomalies chez les animaux malades ou blessésMLISTThe anomalies observed in the sick or injured animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedAucune anomalie évidenteTeneur anormale en gazComportement anormalMauvaise odeurSaignement, plaie, contusionsPartie du corps manquanteDiarhee ou vomissementRespiration difficile, touxFracture, déformation, inflammation, prolapsusPerte de poils ou plumesHuilé/recouvert de substanceProblème bebout marcher volerPeau anormaleMince ou maigreEcoulement blanchâtre, rougeâtre et jauneAutresAutres anomalies malades ou blessésTEXTA text field to provide anomalies observed in the sick or injured animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident not given in the 'Anomalies in Sick or Injured Animals' AttributeCause potentielle maladie ou blessureMLISTThe potential causes of disease or injury in the sick or injured animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedInconnuDéshydratationNoyéElectrocutionEnchevêtreéEquipement de pêcheCoup de feuMaladie infectieuseVieuxAutres maladies non infectieusesEmpoisonnement ou toxinePrédationÉchouéFamineArme traditionnellePiègeTraumatisme ou collisionAccident de véhiculeNombre d'animaux mortsNUMERICThe number of dead animals of the corresponding species at the IncidentEtat des animaux mortsMLISTThe condition of the dead animals of he corresponding species found at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedCarcasses fraîchesDécomposition précoceDécomposition avancéeFuméePeau et osAnomalies sur des cadavresThe anomalies observed in the dead animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedAucune anomalie évidenteComportement anormalTeneur anormale en gazMauvaise odeurSaignement, plaie, contusionsPartie du corps manquanteDiarhee ou vomissementRespiration difficile, touxFracture, déformation, inflammation, prolapsusPerte de poils ou plumesHuilé/recouvert de substanceProblème Debout Marcher VolerPeau anormaleMince ou maigreEcoulement blanchâtre, rougeâtre et jauneAutresAutres anomalies mortesTEXTA text field to provide anomalies observed in the dead animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident not given in the 'Anomalies in Dead Animals' AttributeCause potentielle de décèsMLISTThe potential causes of death in the dead animals of the corresponding species observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedInconnuNoyéDéshydratationElectrocutionEnchevêtréEquipement de pêcheCoup de feuMaladie infectieuseVieuxAutres maladies non infectieusesEmpoisonnement ou toxinePrédationFamineÉchouéArme traditionnellePiègeTraumatisme ou collisionAccident de véhiculeAttaque de carnivoreLISTThe type of carnivore associated with predation if among the potential cause of injury or death the 'Predation' option selectedChienChatCarnivore sauvageOui, mais carnivore inconnuAutres informations pertinentesTEXTA text field to provide any other relevant information regarding the animals of the corresponding species

title: Bétail et Animaux Domestiques

title: Animal et Echantillons
text: AttributeTypeAttributeDefinitionTree RootOptionOptionDefinitionEspècesLISTThe species of the animal observed at the Incident Espèces non répertoriéesSelect this option if the species of the animal observed at the Incident is not in the listFournir des espèces non répertoriéesTEXTA text field to provide the species of the animal observed at the Incident if it is not given in the 'Species' AttributeID animalThe code to identify the animal observed at the Incident individually  Catégorie de captivitéLISTThe captivity category of the animal observed at the IncidentEn libertéThe animal observed at the Incident is found in its habitat and not hunted, captured, captive, or restricted. The animal captured for health surveillance purposes is considered 'free-ranging'Traqués et déplacésThe animal observed at the Incident is hunted or captured at the time of the observation; however, it has been displaced from the original place of hunt or capture. For example, a caged animal in posession of a walking hunter in a protected areaChassé et non déplacéThe animal observed at the Incident is hunted or captured at the time of the observation; however, it has not been displaced from the original place of hunt or capture. For example, an animal observed in the trap set by a hunterCentre de secours/réadaptationThe animal observed at the Incident is kept in a rehabilitation/rescue centerFermeThe animal observed at the Incident is kept in a farmMénageThe animal observed at the Incident is kept in a householdRecherche ou capture pour conservationThe animal observed at the Incident is captured as part of a research or conservation initiative not related with health surveillanceMarchéThe animal observed at the Incident is kept in a marketPoste commercialThe animal observed at the Incident is kept in a trade postEtatThe health condition in which the animal is found at the Incident Trouvé mortTrouvé vivant, malade ou blesséTrouvé vivant en bonne santéParties d'animauxAge de l'animalThe age of the animal observed at the IncidentAdulte Juvénile Fœtus Inconnu Sexe de l'animalThe sex of the animal observed at the Incident InconnuFemelleMâleAnomalies chez les animaux malades, blessés ou mortsMLISTThe anomalies in the animal observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedAucune anomalie évidente Comportement anormal Teneur anormale en gaz Mauvaise odeur Saignement, plaie, contusions Partie du corps manquante Diarhee ou vomissement Respiration difficile, toux Fracture, déformation, inflammation, prolapsus Perte de poils ou plumes Huilé/recouvert de substance Problème bebout marcher voler Peau anormale Mince ou maigre Ecoulement blanchâtre, rougeâtre et jaune Autres Autres anomaliesTEXTA text field to register the anomalies in the animal observed at the Incident that are not present in the 'Anomalies in Sick, Injured, or Dead Animals' Attribute Cause suspecte du décès, de la maladie ou de la blessureTREEThe potential cause of death, disease, or injury in the animal observed at the Incident. Multiple options can be selectedAnimal en bonne santé AccidentGrève de bateau Bâtiment ou structure Noyé Electrocuté Enchevêtré Equipement de pêche Filet Autres traumatismes Problème de capture ou d'immobilisation Ecrasé par un véhicule Échoué Déshydratation Famine Euthanasie Chasser ou contrôlerAbattage Coup de feu Filet Autres armes Contrôle des animaux à problèmes Chasse sportive Chasse traditionnelle Piège Maladie infectieuse Vieux Empoisonnement ou toxine PrédationChat Chien Carnivore sauvage Oui, mais carnivore inconnu Inconnu ID de l'échantillonTEXTAnswer to the question 'was the carcass of the animal observed at the Incident collected?Type de l'échantillonLISTAbcèsThe code to identify each sample collected from the animal observed at the Incident individually Glande surrénale The type of sample collected from the animal observed at the IncidentSac d'airCaillot de sangFluide de cavité corporelleOsMoelleCerveauLiquide cérébro-spinalSubstance chimiqueContenu des culturesFèces sèchesViande sècheŒsophageŒilPlumeFœtusPapier filtrePucesFèces fraîchesViande fraîcheVésicule biliaireContenu gastriquePoilsCœurLiquide articulaireReinGros intestinPouxFoiePoumonGanglion lymphatiqueGlande mammaireLaitAcariensTissu mixteEcouvillon nasalNerfEcouvillon oralEcouvillon oronasalAutres tissusOvairePancréasPlasmaPlathelminthesEcouvillonnage rectal ou cloacalVers rondsViande saléeSédimentSérumPeauIntestin grêleMoelle épinièreRateEstomacTesticulesGlande thyroïdeTiquesLangueDentTrachéeOmbilicParasite non classéUrineVessieEcouvillon urogénitalUtérusVomissementSang totalCollecté directement auprès d'un animalNonOuiLa carcasse a-t-elle été récupéréeAnswer to the question 'was the sample collected directly from the animal observed at the Incident?' Non Oui Autres informations pertinentesTEXTA text field to provide any other relevant information regarding the sample collected from the animal observed at the Incident
